Package net.proteusframework.email

Provides a centralized way to handle e-mail templates in Proteus.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    EmailConfigType<EC extends EmailConfig>
    Defines an IImplementationModel for configuring EmailTemplate s for specific uses.
    EmailConfigType.PreInitContext
    Pre Component.init data that may be useful for creating your UI code.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    EmailConfig
    Base class for EmailConfiguration entities.
    EmailTemplate
    The central entity for persistent e-mail templates.
    EmailTemplateContext
    Context information when operating on EmailTemplates.
    EmailTemplateDAO
    Data access object for EmailTemplate.
    EmailTemplateProcessor
    Processor for email templates.
    EmailTemplateRecipient
    EmailTemplate Recipient.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    EmailTemplateContext.Mode
    Process mode.
    EmailTemplateContext.StandardAttribute
    Standard attributes for the processing context.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    EmailTemplateException
    Exception thrown to indicate an error related to EmailTemplate processing / use.

Package net.proteusframework.email Description

Provides a centralized way to handle e-mail templates in Proteus. The primary entity is EmailTemplate, managed with EmailTemplateDAO. Send emails using EmailTemplateProcessor. When sending an email, you will need to create an EmailTemplateContext to provide send-time context information to the EmailTemplateProcessor. Templates can only be "used" by a single system at a time, meaning that a business process and a form cannot share the same template, and the same template instance may not be used across multiple sites (though it may be copied). This makes it possible for email template editors to know at edit time how a template will be used, so they can provide information about template variables. The concept of a system using a template is represented by EmailConfig, along with EmailConfigType. Typically there is one EmailConfigType for each system that will use email templates, and one EmailConfig for each email template being used. When the EmailConfig is set on an EmailTemplate, that template is ready to be used. The configuration provides variables for the template using the domain model API, and it provides a few pieces of data for UIs.
